required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Healthy Adult Volunteer Study of Intraosseous Infusion Using the Sternum
clinical_study.official_title: A Follow-Up Volunteer Study Evaluating Intraosseous Vascular Access Infusion in the Sternum Using the EZ-IO T.A.L.O.N.Intraosseous System.

brief_summary.textblock: This study is being done to evaluate intraosseous vascular access through the sternum.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the presence or absence of extravasation when using the T.A.L.O.N. Intraosseous System to establish sternal intraosseous infusion. This study will also evaluate the user preference feedback received from the device operators about the ease of use and level of satisfaction with the device. Lastly, this study will evaluate the infusion flow rates obtained when using intraosseous infusion in the sternum.

primary_outcome.description: The number of occurrences of extravasation with intraosseous infusion as evidenced by contrast injection into the intraosseous catheter, visualized under fluoroscopic imaging.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During insertion of the intraosseous needle set
secondary_outcome.description: Operator's perceived stability of the sternal locator once placed on the subject. 1 to 5 scale was used with 1=Poor; 2=Fair; 3=Good; 4=Very good; 5=Excellent.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During insertion of the intraosseous needle set
secondary_outcome.description: Ability to stabilize the catheter hub and rotate the stylet for removal. 1 to 5 scale was used with 1=Very difficult; 2-Difficult; 3=Neutral; 4=Easy; 5=Very easy.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During insertion of the intraosseous needle set
secondary_outcome.description: Perceived effeciveness of the device adhesion strips after application. A 1- 5 scale was used with 1=Poor; 2=Fair; 3=Good; $=Very good; 5=Excellent.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the 12 minute infusion time frame
secondary_outcome.description: Measure the infusion flow rates attainable in the sternum when using intraosseous infusion of normal saline using a gravity infusion (no Pressure).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the 12 minute infusion time frame
secondary_outcome.description: Measure the infusion flow rates attainable in the sternum when using intraosseous infusion of normal saline using a 100 mmHg infusion.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the 12 minute infusion time frame
secondary_outcome.description: Measure the infusion flow rates attainable in the sternum when using intraosseous infusion of normal saline using a 200 mmHg infusion.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the 12 minute infusion time frame
secondary_outcome.description: Measure the infusion flow rates attainable in the sternum when using intraosseous infusion of normal saline using a 300 mmHg infusion.

arm_group.description: Sternal intraosseous vascular access using T.A.L.O.N. Intraosseous System.

intervention.description: intraosseous catheter for use in the sternum

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Healthy adults aged 21 years and older were recruited to participate in the study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
